meanings.definition: Having holes already punched in it.
meanings.sent1: The prepunched paper made it easy to put in a binder.
meanings.sent2: The prepunched cards were ready to be organized.
meanings.sent3: The prepunched tickets saved us time at the event.
meanings.sent4: Her prepunched belt was like a constellation of stars.
meanings.sent5: The prepunched fabric looked like a connect-the-dots puzzle.

meanings.definition: To punch holes in something before it is used.
meanings.sent1: She prepunched the cards for the presentation.
meanings.sent2: He always prepunched his documents for filing.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepunched the dough to make decorative patterns.
meanings.sent4: The gardener prepunched the soil for planting seeds.
meanings.sent5: The tailor prepunched the fabric before sewing.
